unit_learning_outcomes.description: Formulate and solve applied problems using linear modelling.
Use standard statistics packages to carry out these analyses
Formulate and solve theoretical problems in linear modelling (using matrix notation when necessary).
Communicate clearly your knowledge of the subject matter of linear models and their solutions to problems involving linear modelling.
Analyse the adequacy of a linear model and suggest appropriate modifications when needed.
Fit a linear model to obtain estimates together with their standard errors in applied problems.
Define relevant terminology and describe the main concepts of linear models and simple generalized linear models.

enrolment_rules.description: 20cp at 2000 level including (STAT270 or STAT2170 or STAT271 or STAT2371 or BIOL235(P) or BIOL2610(P) or PSY222 or PSY248(P) or PSYU2248(P)) and (10cp from FOSE1005 or MATH1000 or MATH1010-MATH1025 or MATH111-MATH339)

assessments.description: Reinforce and apply the concepts covered in lectures and the skills learned in SGTA classes through data analysis.
Formal invigilated examination testing the learning outcomes of the unit.
Students are required to submit a short report of the activities in the computer laboratory Small Group Teaching Activities (SGTA)
Reinforce and apply the concepts covered in lectures and the skills learned in SGTA sessions, through data analysis.
Reinforce and apply the concepts covered in lectures and the skills learned in SGTA sessions, through data analysis.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit discusses statistical modelling in general and in particular demonstrates the wide applicability of linear and generalized linear models. Topics include multiple linear regression, logistic regression and Poisson regression. The emphasis is on practical issues in data analysis with some reference to the theoretical background. Statistical packages are used for both model fitting and diagnostic testing.
data.title: Linear Models

description: This unit discusses statistical modelling in general and in particular demonstrates the wide applicability of linear and generalized linear models. Topics include multiple linear regression, logistic regression and Poisson regression. The emphasis is on practical issues in data analysis with some reference to the theoretical background. Statistical packages are used for both model fitting and diagnostic testing.
title: Linear Models
